newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent trims losses as NYMEX gasoline heads up.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent trims losses as NYMEX gasoline heads up.

text.p: IPE Brent trimmed earlier losses in mid-afternoon trade, pulled off lows by a recovery on NYMEX gasoline.
Feb Brent was trading 15 cents down at $24.42 a barrel at 1610 GMT, having dipped to a low of $24.18.

NYMEX gasoline recovered slightly in early trade from sharp falls on Thursday prompted by news that up to a million tonnes of January-loading gasoline will head to the U.S. from Europe this month. "Gasoline is the one to watch and it's making some effort to break higher again," said one dealer.
As expected, NYMEX crude and heating oil came under pressure at the open in spite of forecasts of colder weather having failed to break key technical resistance on Thursday, dealers said.
IPE Feb gas oil, the new front-month headed lower as temperatures in Europe started to climb back to normal levels after a long cold snap.
Feb gas oil was trading $2.50 a tonne down at $228.25 at 1614 GMT.
Deliveries into the Jan contract, which expired at midday will be 2,617 lots, or 261,700 tonnes, an IPE official said.
The delivery is higher than December's 87,900 tonnes but far off November's record 865,100 tonnes.
